body_content.explanation: someone who does not know, or believes that it is impossible to know, if a god exists:
examples: Although he was raised a Catholic, he was an agnostic for most of his adult life.
The group includes atheists and agnostics as well as religious believers.

body_content.explanation: someone who does not know or does not have an opinion about whether something is true, good, correct, etc.:
examples: He claims to be an agnostic on the question of man-made global warming.
I am an agnostic when it comes to his art and its merits.

body_content.explanation: having the belief that it is not possible to know whether god exists:
examples: Whether we are religious, atheist, or agnostic, there are some moral values we all share.
He is agnostic on the existence of God.

body_content.explanation: not knowing or not having an opinion about whether something is true, good, correct, etc.:
examples: She remained agnostic on the question of whether to join the war.
We could never be agnostic about the virtues of political freedom.

body_content.explanation: relating to hardware or software that can be used with many different types of platform (= system)
